greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Aliquot sequence starting at 30.
comment: The sum-of-divisor function A000203 and thus aliquot parts A001065 are defined only for positive integers, so the trajectory ends when 0 is reached, here at index 15. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 24 2018
reference: Richard K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, B6.
link: Index entries for sequences related to aliquot parts.
example: 30 has eight divisors, 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 10, 15, 30, which add up to 72, and 72 - 30 = 42, so a(1) = 42.
maple: f := proc(n) option remember; if n = 0 then 30; else sigma(f(n-1))-f(n-1); fi; end:
program: (PARI) a(n, a=30)=for(i=1, n, a=sigma(a)-a); a \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 24 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
